instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message:
No History
Doesn't Power ON No Green Light ( Very dim)

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.58V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.418V
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE_R</SIGNAL>: 16.44V

Replaced the magsafe connector board:
Green Light OK
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE_R</SIGNAL>: 3.398V

Then no S5 State

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0482V if L7220 removed then 0V on Pin 1
<SIGNAL>3V3S5_ENTRIP</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>: 3.396V

Replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 3.317V
PP1V1R1V05_S5: 1.059V

Then No S3 State
When shorting the power pads <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is pulsing

At MCP79 (<CHIP>U1400</CHIP>):

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>: 3.401V
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>: 3.313V pulsing to 0V when shorting the power pads
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>: 3.417V pulsing to 0V when shorting the power pads
<SIGNAL>RTC_RST_L</SIGNAL> : 3.403V solid even if shorting the power pads
<SIGNAL>MCP_PS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> : 0V and slightly pulsing when shorting the power pads
32kHz is OK

Mesured the resistance to gnd of <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, and I have around 20 Ohms and in diode mode it's 0.021V which is too low and means that I have a "short" to gnd on that rail.
Removed L7620 and the short is on the pin 1 side the same for <RESISTOR>R7267</RESISTOR> not on the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> that I've already replaced before....
Lifted <CAPACITOR>C7290</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7291</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7293</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C4801</CAPACITOR> still have the short.....
After a deep inspection of the board I've noticed that <CAPACITOR>C6603</CAPACITOR> was fried and removed it: still the same.
So I also removed all the audio amps and their capacitors: <CHIP>U6610</CHIP>,<CHIP>U6620</CHIP>,<CHIP>U6630</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C6601</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6605</CAPACITOR> and the short is still present......it could be anywhere on the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> rail.......but now the resitance to Gnd is 26 Ohms....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message:
I will check all the associate rails to <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_REG</SIGNAL>:
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_P5VS0FET</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_ODD</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_AUDIO_AMP</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_AUDIO</SIGNAL>
=PP5V_S3_1V5S30V75S0
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_TPAD</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_WLAN</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_VTTCLAMP</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_MCPDDRFET</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_SYSLED</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_IR</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_BTCAMERA</SIGNAL>
=<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_EXTUSB</SIGNAL>

As it's a long job and this board is not urgent I'll do few of them time to time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message:
Check first resistance to ground on 3V42 power rail in ohm scale; you should get more than 30K.
Lower value points to bad MCP...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message:
Resistance to GND for PP3V42 is 2.5KOhms

And here my mesurement regarding "short" on  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>.......but if the MCP is bad It doesn't worth to continu removing the ones I haven't done so far.....

Removed components:

For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_P5VS0FET</SIGNAL>:  <TRANSISTOR>Q7940</TRANSISTOR>
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_ODD</SIGNAL>: <TRANSISTOR>Q4590</TRANSISTOR>
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_AUDIO_AMP</SIGNAL>: <CHIP>U6610</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6620</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6630</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C6601</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C6603</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C6605</CAPACITOR>
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_AUDIO</SIGNAL>:  U 6200, <CHIP>U6500</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C6213</CAPACITOR>
For  PP5V_S3_1V5S30V75S0 : <RESISTOR>R7307</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7302</CAPACITOR>
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_WLAN</SIGNAL>: <TRANSISTOR>Q3450</TRANSISTOR>
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_TPAD</SIGNAL>: <RESISTOR>R5873</RESISTOR> ( short stay on pin 1) , <CAPACITOR>C5800</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> ( short stay on pin 2)
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_SYSLED</SIGNAL>: <RESISTOR>R5030</RESISTOR> short stay on pin 1
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_MCPDDRFET</SIGNAL> only checked Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7901</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7903</RESISTOR> for short: None
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_VTTCLAMP</SIGNAL> only checked fort short on Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7976</RESISTOR>: None
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_BTCAMERA</SIGNAL>:  Removed L3405 looking for short on the Camera connector: None
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_IR</SIGNAL>: <RESISTOR>R4532</RESISTOR> short stays on Pin 2
For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_EXTUSB</SIGNAL>: <CHIP>U4690</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C4691</CAPACITOR>

Next Time I Will still have to remove <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6700</CHIP> for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_AUDIO</SIGNAL>
and <CHIP>U4800</CHIP> <CAPACITOR>C4801</CAPACITOR> for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_IR</SIGNAL>

Please confirm regarding bad MCP......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message: 2.5K is wayyy too low. Dead MCP RIP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message: Stop to waste time; MCP is history now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power No S3
threads.message: Thanks Guys, this one will go in the donor Bin.......lol
